Author: meatspoon#7860
Content: Geez, i make a comment and @allbits says its "slander" and "uninformed accusations".  An opinion, when offered as such, isn't slander.  A small number of people made a killing mining and selling ARRR.  Most ARRR holders are currently underwater (luckily, I am not one of them and have never owed ARRR).  The miners hyped it in these channels.  Time will obviously tell who is right and who is wrong, and I am happy to be proven wrong.  But there are tons of fanbois in here and they deserve to eat a little bit of humble pie for all of their "best tech" and "game changer" talk which is commonplace around here as @richardt pointed out.  Some members of this community have a bit of a habit of punching above their weight class.

Author: meatspoon#7860
Content: Yeah, around here for the past 2 years it has been, "KMD is on sale, now is the time to stack!" but when people get critical of the project or the performance of their investment, all the people who were talking up KMD (to no significant avail) for the past two years dog on that individual and imply they are no good at trading or are over exposed or whatever.  People who have appropriate levels of exposure and are willing to HODL should also be able to be critical of KMD.  But I guess it makes sense... those who have been chanting "buy" all the way down that giant down-slope of a chart are probably pretty emotionally committed to that.

Author: BoBot-BUY KMD#8821
Content: @Markus because I'm a masochist lol

Author: meatspoon#7860
Content: i know hindsight is 20/20 and all of that, but there are a lot of KMD maximalists in this discord who essentially got rekt in terms of opportunity cost.  They kind of drank the koolaid that BTC is a shit coin and that KMD is the absolute best.  Some of those people maybe have "successfully" traded to increase their KMD stacks, but would have been better off just buying and holding BTC.  So its worth pointing out that those who get prickly when KMD is critiqued, many of them have made very poor decisions in the last couple of years because they have a thus far unwarranted preference for KMD.  That preference has rekt 'em.

Author: meatspoon#7860
Content: and it doesnt help that so many KMD ecosystem coins are scams or shit coins or sketchy

Author: Kitchen Table#2858
Content: You should have seen the shit I got for asking why is Chips not working a year ago. Swore to never invest into anything in the KMD ecosystem since. Looking at how the new stuff has performed, I say it was a good decision.

Author: meatspoon#7860
Content: @Lanii yeah, there are some very opinionated ball busters in here.  criticism is not really taken on board in a neutral, philosophical manner.  Its kind of weird because JL is pretty even keeled and handles criticism pretty well.  But for the most part here, if you criticize KMD, its like you are insulting people's mothers or something.  The tribalism is strong.  The other thing that is sort of unique to KMD is that most people here talk shit on literally every other coin out there that isnt KMD related.  As if every other crypto project out there is total shit that insults their superior intelligence just by existing.

Author: meatspoon#7860
Content: i always think about ETH when these discussions occur.  ETH has plenty to criticize, for sure, but the KMD maximalists crap on it like its the worst thing in the world despite it having many legitimate projects with actual use cases in the top 100.  What is the KMD equivalent to BAT?  Or to Augur or Storj or Golem?  There is no equivalent because devs are choosing, of their own free will, to work on ETH projects.  Yet ETH sucks, KMD rules, rinse and repeat.

Author: meatspoon#7860
Content: @Kitchen Table Yeah, i just don't get Chips.  It is often referenced as a success story of a KMD ecosystem coin in here...  I guess I am just not savvy enough to grasp its potential.  But it is disconcerting (for me, at least) when the KMD crew references how awesome it is... kind of undermines their credibility, in my flawed opinion.
